site_title: Malaysia's Proton launches its first electric vehicle
summary: Malaysia's Proton has launched its first electric vehicle, the e.MAS 7, priced at RM109,800 (S$33,249.92) for the basic model and RM123,800 for the premium model. The move aims to boost EV and hybrid sales to 20% of new car sales by 2030, with a 112% rise in battery EV sales in the first half of the year. Proton, majority-owned by DRB HICOM, joins BYD, Tesla, and Stellantis in the local market, as the country seeks to gain a foothold in the global supply chain.

site_title: China’s ‘old shop’ jeweller bucks slowdown with 437% stock rally
summary: Laopu Gold, a Beijing-based jeweller, has bucked China's retail slowdown with a 437% stock rally since its listing in June. The company expects to add 10 new stores in mainland China and around five in other Asian cities, driven by its luxury heritage gold jewellery and fixed pricing strategy. Revenue is on course to more than double this year, and analysts predict a 55% annual revenue growth from 2024 to 2026. Laopu's small size and focus on quality have allowed it to maintain exclusivity, drawing comparisons to global luxury brands like Cartier and Tiffany & Co.

images.alt_text: Jewellery retailer Chow Tai Fook Jewellery Group is facing significant headwinds in mainland China, which accounts for more than 80 per cent of its revenue.

site_title: Lifestyle hub Kada blends heritage with hipster cafes
summary: A new lifestyle hub, Kada, is set to open in Singapore, blending heritage with hipster cafes. Located in a 101-year-old modernist building, the hub features 17 offerings, including trendy cafes, restaurants, a gym, and co-living rooms. The building's quirky electric elevator, a relic from the early 20th century, is expected to become a viral attraction. Kada aims to promote healthy and creative living, with a focus on holistic lifestyle ecosystem. The hub is part of Singapore Land Authority's mission to adapt heritage buildings for commercial use.

images.alt_text: The interiors of Sugarra, a new Basque-centric, northern Spanish restaurant taking over the defunct table65.

site_title: Tokyo to make day care free to boost birth rate
summary: Tokyo plans to make day care free for all preschool children starting in September, aiming to boost Japan's low birth rate. The move expands a policy of free day care for second-born and subsequent children to first-borns. This effort seeks to reduce the financial burden on families and address the country's declining population. Japan's birth rate has been declining for years, with the population facing significant challenges. The move is part of the city's efforts to encourage families to have more children.

images.alt_text: The scramble for Seven & i gives a taste of how deals are likely to develop in the years to come, industry experts say, as changes in Japan Inc’s corporate governance standards make delisting an increasingly compelling option.

site_title: Swiss bank watchdog blundered on Credit Suisse, report finds
summary: A Swiss parliamentary commission report has criticized the Swiss financial regulator Finma for a 2017 decision that granted Credit Suisse relief from capital requirements, allowing the bank to maintain an unsustainable business model. The report blames the leadership of Credit Suisse for the bank's collapse, but also criticizes Finma for not taking corrective measures in time. The report's findings have led to calls for new legislation to repair Switzerland's financial center, including the power to fine systemically-important banks and individuals. The Swiss government has announced plans to strengthen supervision and implement lessons learned from the Credit Suisse case.

images.alt_text: UBS said in a statement that it “welcomes the court’s decision to acquit the bank in connection with a legacy matter related to Credit Suisse.”
Last year, Switzerland’s second-largest bank was taken over by rival UBS Group in an emergency rescue brokered by the Swiss government.
Last year’s crash of Credit Suisse has shaken the confidence of wealthy clients from Europe and the Middle East, with some doubts arising about the stability of the Swiss banking centre.
UBS’s involvement in the Barbados deal underlines its gradual expansion into nature finance markets following its takeover of Credit Suisse.
There has been vigorous debate in Switzerland about the size and power of UBS since it took over Credit Suisse last year in a state-engineered rescue.
The call is one of Finma’s demands for increased powers after the authority came under fire over its handling of Credit Suisse’s collapse last year.
“The completion of the merger within the expected timeline was facilitated by the strong support from regulators across the globe,” UBS said.

site_title: Taylor Swift’s record-breaking Eras tour set to bring in revenue at well over US$2 billion
summary: Taylor Swift's record-breaking Eras tour is set to conclude with a final performance in Vancouver, having grossed over $2 billion in revenue, surpassing Elton John's previous record of $939 million. The tour, which kicked off in Arizona in 2023, spanned 149 shows across the globe, generating significant economic activity in cities like Toronto, where it is estimated to have generated $282 million in local economic activity. The tour received widespread critical acclaim, with reviewers praising Swift's stamina and energy, despite some setbacks, including cancelled shows and a fan's death due to heat exhaustion.

site_title: Stocks to watch: Del Monte Pacific, Trek 2000 International
summary: Del Monte Pacific reported a net loss of US$22.2 million for the second quarter, citing lower profit and higher costs from its US subsidiary. The company expects a net loss for FY2025 but aims to restore gross margins by FY2026 and FY2027. Meanwhile, Trek 2000 International denied allegations by Osim International and Ron Sim that former chairman Henn Tan made fraudulent representations in 2015, with Tan previously serving a jail sentence for accounting fraud. Lonza Group called for a trading halt due to unspecified reasons.

site_title:
Money isn’t just meant for investing – 
treat yourself, too
summary: A personal finance expert reevaluates their approach to managing money after speaking with a CEO and a colleague. Initially, they prioritized saving and investing, but realized that "the whole purpose of money is to enable happiness." They now consider buying something frivolous or donating to a cause as a way to bring joy and happiness. The expert shares their own experience of purchasing an Android game console, which may not be practical but brings them happiness, and encourages readers to do the same, as being in a happier state of mind can help them tackle the new year with more energy and strength.

summary: The article highlights various Christmas gift options for food lovers in Singapore. Brands such as Atipico, The Caramelier, Fullerton Hotel Singapore, Pan Pacific Singapore, and TWG Tea offer gourmet hampers and festive treats. A unique option is Fullerton Hotel's Peranakan-inspired roast pongteh turkey, paired with a coconut snow yule log. These gifts cater to different tastes and preferences, making them suitable for friends and family alike.

site_title: Auditor-flagged Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine sets up strategic review panel
summary: Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine (SAM) has set up a strategic review panel to improve its performance amid slower-than-expected ramp-up of proton beam therapy. The panel, comprising five non-executive directors and external professionals, will examine ways to boost usage of proton beam therapy, photon radiation therapy facilities, and diagnostic equipment. The move comes after external auditors PwC issued a disclaimer of opinion on SAM's results for FY2024, citing material uncertainties that could cast doubt on the company's ability to continue as a going concern, and reporting a loss of S$37.4 million.

images.alt_text: The auditors noted the presence of material uncertainties that could cast significant doubt on the ability of the Singapore Institute of Advanced Medical Holdings (SIAMH) to continue as going concerns to stay afloat In a report dated Dec 9.

Singapore is the worst performing market for South-east Asia for IPOs this year, with just one IPO in the first three quarters of the year. Cancer treatment provider Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine Holdings’ (SIAMH) Catalist listing in February raised gross proceeds of S$26.2 million or net proceeds of S$21.7 million.
Incorporated in 2011 and founded by Dr Djeng Shih Kien, SIAMH focuses on diagnosing and treating various diseases and health conditions.

site_title: Yuan, euro rout points to losses for emerging-market currencies
summary: The Chinese yuan and euro have weakened, dragging down emerging-market currencies in Asia and Europe. The yuan's decline is attributed to China's stimulus measures and a surging US dollar, while the euro's weakness stems from speculation over European Central Bank interest-rate cuts and US tariffs. Strong trade linkages and the yuan's role as a "currency anchor" for emerging currencies have contributed to the correlations between the yuan and other currencies. This has led to concerns about contagion effects and potential losses for emerging-market currencies.

site_title: Last-minute Christmas gift guide
summary:
Here's a 100-word or less summary of the article content:

A last-minute Christmas gift guide features designer options from Coach, Louis Vuitton, Dior, Celine, Prada, and others. The list includes stylish accessories like bags, wallets, and scarves, as well as luxury items like scented candles and sneakers. Key items include Coach's Crystal Rivets Quilted Tabby shoulder bag, Louis Vuitton's Neverfull Bandouliere Inside Out MM, and Dior's Gravity Hit the Road messenger bag. Prices range from $400 to $6,200, making these gifts suitable for various budgets and recipients. The guide aims to provide quick and impressive gift ideas for those running out of time.

site_title: Fitch Ratings upgrades Astrea VI Class A-2 bonds
summary: Fitch Ratings has upgraded the Astrea VI Class A-2 bonds from "Asf" to "A+sf", reflecting the expectation that the bonds can withstand significant decline in their transaction net asset values while passing Fitch's ratings requirement. The upgrade comes after the bonds saw strong demand, with the latest tranche launched in July launching 2.8 times subscribed. The upgrade is attributed to the private equity backing of the bonds.

images.alt_text: The total subscription for Astrea 8 private equity bonds was over S$1 billion, more than three times of the bonds offered.
Earlier issuances of Astrea bonds have enjoyed credit rating upgrades, which are testament to their quality.
The Astrea 8 bonds commenced trading on the Singapore Exchange on Jul 22.

site_title: Foxconn posts muted monthly sales growth while AI demand slows
summary: Foxconn, the manufacturing partner of Apple, reported sales of NT$672.59 billion (S$27.8 billion) for November, a 3.5% increase from the previous month, despite concerns about weak iPhone sales. This growth is not expected to offset weak sales, as demand for AI infrastructure slows down. The company's sales trail the projected 13% growth for the quarter, raising questions about the returns on massive spending on AI servers and data centers by big tech firms. US President-elect Donald Trump's threat to impose tariffs on Taiwanese contract manufacturers also weighs on the sector.

site_title: Pizza and cocktails at Anto
summary: Anto, a new Italian eatery in Singapore, offers a limited menu featuring various pizza options, including grana padano cheese balls, bruschetta, and panettone. The restaurant's atmosphere is minimalist, with a semi-lounge area but limited seating options. Cocktails and wine are available, priced at $25. The reviewer found the pizzas to be underwhelming, with the exception of the Mortazza pizza, which held up well to reheating. The desserts, including deep-fried pizza, were also a letdown. Overall, Anto received a rating of 6 out of 10.

images.alt_text: Roomy tables at Ushiyama.

site_title: Singapore retail sales up 2.2% in October with mixed performance across industries
summary: Singapore's retail sales rose 2.2% in October, with motor vehicles showing the strongest growth. Eight sectors reported year-on-year growth, while fast-food outlet takings declined 1.5%. Online sales accounted for 12.7% of total retail sales. Despite a slight dip in month-on-month sales, economists are optimistic about sustained growth in the fourth quarter, driven by favourable base effects and government support measures.

site_title: Crisis to crisis: South Korea’s unpopular president
summary: South Korea's President Yoon Suk-yeol faces impeachment after imposing martial law, which sparked widespread protests. The opposition claims Yoon "gravely violated the constitution and the law" and sought to evade investigations into alleged illegal acts. Yoon's presidency has been marred by scandals, including a crowd crush that killed over 150 people and allegations of abusing presidential vetoes. The opposition Democratic Party has filed a motion to impeach Yoon, who has been a lame duck president since the party won a majority in parliamentary elections this year.

images.alt_text: The won has been among the biggest victims from the row that swept the nation and raised concerns about South Korea’s credit worthiness.

site_title: UN aviation agency at 80 challenged by climate change, rising traffic
summary: The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO), established 80 years ago, faces challenges from climate change and rising air traffic. ICAO is working with investors and fuel producers to boost sustainable aviation fuel volumes, aiming to reduce flight emissions. The organization aims to achieve net-zero aviation emissions by 2050 and manage limited airspace supply as traffic increases, particularly in Asia and the Middle East. Despite criticism for slow decision-making, ICAO remains committed to cooperation and finding solutions through compromise.

images.alt_text: While carriers would require a significant number of aircraft, Boeing and Airbus have shown how difficult it is for them to increase production, says Avolon chief executive Cronin.

site_title: Huge Vietnam fraud case raises questions over banking system
summary: A Vietnamese court has upheld the death sentence of property developer Truong My Lan for embezzling $27 billion from the Saigon Commercial Bank, exposing systemic weaknesses in the country's banking sector. The case highlights extensive corruption and a lack of regulation, with experts warning that similar cases could emerge. The Vietnamese financial system's corporate bond market is characterized by a lack of tight state management, and experts say a key weakness is the lack of regulation, which allowed Lan to mislead investors and cause widespread losses.

images.alt_text: Truong My Lan (centre), the chairwoman of real estate developer Van Thinh Phat Holdings Group, was sentenced to death in April for her role in a financial fraud worth more than US$12 billion, Vietnam’s biggest on record.
Vietnam is a significant exporter to the US and has a large trade surplus with Washington.

The court ruled in April that Truong My Lan must compensate Saigon Commercial Bank a total of 674 trillion dong – an amount Lan appealed against but still committed to repay “at all costs”.

site_title: Prime Minister Barnier to resign as France’s political crisis deepens
summary: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier is set to resign after a no-confidence vote, marking the shortest-serving prime minister in modern French history. The vote, which saw a small majority of lawmakers approve parliament's decision to bring down Barnier, further weakens President Emmanuel Macron's standing amid growing calls for his resignation. The move plunges France into a new political crisis, with investors already unnerved by the uncertainty, and comes weeks before US President-elect Donald Trump's return to the White House.

images.alt_text: A screen shows the result of the no-confidence vote against the French prime minister and his government at the National Assembly, Paris, France, Dec 4, 2024. The government lost the no-confidence vote after a total of 331 members of the parliament voted in favour of the motion.

A standoff over an austerity budget, which has caused jitters on financial markets, follows months of tension since President Emmanuel Macron appointed Michel Barnier (pictured) as prime minister in September.

site_title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise reports strong sales growth on boost from AI, servers
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) reported strong quarterly revenue growth of 15% to $8.5 billion, driven by a 32% increase in server sales to power AI workloads, reaching $4.7 billion. The company also saw a 16% increase in AI system revenue to $1.5 billion. HPE's shares rose 2% in extended trading, and the stock has gained 28% this year. The company expects the deal to close its planned acquisition of Juniper Networks in the early part of 2025.

images.alt_text: Any deal is expected to include US$6.5 billion of investment-grade unsecured bonds maturing in five to 30 years and a US$3 billion term loan, according to HPE.

site_title: Indonesia braces for VAT hike as government signals green light amid public opposition
summary: Indonesia's government is poised to implement a 12% value-added tax (VAT) hike from 11% starting January next year, despite public opposition. President Prabowo Subianto's administration has confirmed the increase, citing existing laws and plans to roll out subsidies to mitigate its impact. Businesses and consumers are bracing for the financial ripple effects, with many companies notifying customers of impending price adjustments. Analysts warn that the VAT rise could shrink Indonesia's GDP by up to 65.3 trillion rupiah, with household consumption expected to take a major hit.

images.alt_text: Indonesian businesses and unions have called for the legislated increase in the VAT rate to be paused because the economic environment is deteriorating.

site_title: Could the Hibiki 40 Years Old be the new crown jewel of Japanese whisky?
summary: Suntory's Hibiki 40 Years Old, a rare whisky, has garnered attention for its exceptional blend of 40-year-old whiskies from Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita distilleries. Only 400 bottles are available globally, featuring traditional maki-e lacquerwork, mother-of-pearl inlay, and a wooden box crafted from 12 types of Japanese wood. Released in October 2024, the whisky stands as the pinnacle of age-statement whiskies from Hibiki, with its ultra-refined blend and intricate craftsmanship making it a potential crown jewel of Japanese whisky.

site_title: Nvidia to support AI development in Thailand
summary: Nvidia announced plans to deepen its cooperation with the Thai government on artificial intelligence, agreeing to develop "world-class AI infrastructure" and support over 50 tech startups. CEO Jensen Huang met with Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra during a visit to Bangkok, where the two agreed to share best practices and technical expertise. The partnership aims to support Thailand's AI projects, but does not include significant investments, unlike other tech giants such as Amazon and Google. This move follows a push for investment by Shinawatra's predecessor last year.

site_title: Seattle developer defaults on renovated downtown office towers
summary: Seattle-based developer Martin Selig Real Estate defaulted on a US$200 million loan for two downtown office towers, including a former Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco branch. The loan is tied to the properties' new owners, Acore Capital, which is considering taking control as part of a debt restructuring strategy. The properties' assessed values have dropped significantly, from nearly US$97 million to US$57 million and US$74 million, respectively. The default comes as Seattle's office space remains under pressure, with 25% of downtown office space vacant in the third quarter.

site_title: An enchanting Christmas in Prague
summary: Prague's Christmas season offers an enchanting experience with its historic town squares, cobblestone streets, and Baroque buildings illuminated by a golden glow. The city's famous Christmas market at Old Town Square features a sparkling centrepiece, Prague's tallest Christmas tree, and over 100 stalls offering traditional Czech treats like trdelnik and klobasa. The city's landmarks, such as the Charles Bridge and Prague Castle, are also beautifully showcased during the festive season. With its unique blend of history, culture, and contemporary culture, Prague is a must-visit destination for a magical Christmas experience.

site_title: Nissan stock performs worst in five decades under current CEO
summary: Nissan's stock has plummeted 47% since CEO Makoto Uchida took the helm in 2019, outperforming Japan's Topix by over 100 percentage points. This marks the worst performance under Uchida's leadership in at least five decades, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. His tenure has underwhelmed investors, with shares lagging those of global peers.

images.alt_text: Stephen Ma joined Nissan in 1996 in North America and worked in financial roles in China and Japan before being promoted to CFO in December of 2019.
Nissan’s worldwide output for October decreased 6 per cent from the same month a year earlier to 290,848 vehicles.
Nissan builds cars and engines in Mexico and the spectre of steep tariffs on US imports adds to its woes.

site_title: ESR-Logos Reit to be renamed ESR Reit
summary: ESR-Logos Reit will be renamed ESR Reit from December 4, with the existing counter code J91U remaining unchanged. The registered name of the manager will also be changed from ESR-Logos Funds Management to ESR-Reit Management. The name change aims to better reflect the Reit's status as a part of ESR Group. Units of the Reit were trading 1.9% higher shortly after the market opened on the day of the announcement.

site_title: It’s definitely Damier this season
summary: Louis Vuitton's latest fine jewellery collection, Le Damier de Louis Vuitton, is inspired by the iconic checkerboard motif introduced in 1888. The 12-piece, unisex collection features yellow or white gold squares alternating with diamonds on either side of a geometric central line, creating a fresh and graphic design. Standout pieces include a ring, bracelet, pendant, and hoop earrings, available in various widths, styles, and metals, with prices ranging from S$6,200 to S$40,000. The collection is designed to be worn every day and is perfect for gifting.

site_title: Big Pharma’s bet on China biotech is a rare trade bright spot
summary: Big Pharma is increasingly investing in Chinese biotech, spending over $3.15 billion in 2024, as the US and Europe decouple from Chinese research and development providers. Despite limited success in the global market, Chinese therapies have shown promising early data in clinical trials, and companies are willing to bet on China's growing innovation capabilities. The incoming Trump administration's trade policies may impact cross-border dealmaking, but licensing deals remain a lower-risk option for multinational companies, with many seeking to tap into China's emerging biotech sector.

site_title: Thai finance minister says there’s room for rate cut as inflation is low
summary: Thailand's finance minister, Pichai Chunhavajira, suggests a rate cut to support the economy, citing low inflation. He wants the baht to stabilize at a weaker level to boost growth, which he forecasts at 4-5% next year. The decision, however, will be made by the central bank, the Bank of Thailand. The finance minister also proposes reducing personal and corporate taxes and increasing the value-added tax rate to improve competitiveness.

site_title: Hong Kong doubles this year’s deficit forecast to HK$100 billion, RTHK reports
summary: Hong Kong's Financial Secretary Paul Chan has updated the deficit forecast to HK$100 billion, more than twice the original forecast, citing proceeds from bond issuance. This marks a significant increase from the HK$48.1 billion forecast in February. The financial hub posted a consolidated deficit of HK$101.6 billion for fiscal 2023/24. The change in forecast was not explained by the Financial Secretary's office.

site_title: Man City’s Guardiola hit with ‘sacked in the morning’ taunt after 2-0 defeat to Liverpool
summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola was taunted with "sacked in the morning" after a 2-0 defeat to Liverpool, leaving City 11 points behind the top of the table. Guardiola, who recently extended his contract, showed six fingers, referencing his six Premier League titles, in response to the chants. The loss marks City's sixth defeat in seven games, with Guardiola saying he may be getting the sack if results don't improve.

site_title: Sacha Leong: A designer’s Christmas list
summary: London-based interior designer Sacha Leong shares his Christmas wish list, revealing his passions for design and culture. He desires an annual museum membership, the Corner Bench by Donald Judd, a prototype lamp by Max Lamb, Japanese crafts, a reservation at Singburi, the Sacha armchair by Philippe Malouin, the Kuba chair by Rei Kawakubo, and tickets to a contemporary dance concert at the Barbican Centre. Leong, who has spent his life abroad, credits London for its incredible design culture and diversity, which has inspired his work.

site_title: Conquering the Pacific Ocean
summary: A 19-day journey on the Regent Seven Seas Explorer traversed the Pacific Ocean, echoing Ferdinand Magellan's 1521 route. The voyage began in Vancouver, Canada, and ended in Tokyo, Japan, covering a fraction of the ocean's vast expanse. The journey included stops in Alaska, Dutch Harbor, and the Aleutian Islands, where the writer experienced the wilderness and resilience of local communities. On board, the writer indulged in luxurious amenities and savored seafood delicacies. The journey concluded with a visit to Tokyo, where the writer realized that the true essence of the Pacific lies not in its vastness, but in the connections and memories forged along the way.

site_title: A Christmas debut for Patek Philippe
summary: Patek Philippe unveiled its new Cubitus collection, featuring three iconic models: the Ref 5822P-001 Cubitus, Ref 4962/200R-001 Gondolo Serata, and Ref 5924G-010 Pilot Chronograph. The Cubitus reinterprets the "elegant sporty" style of the Nautilus and Aquanaut collections, while the Gondolo Serata is a jewellery watch with 94 brilliant-cut spessartite gems. The Pilot Chronograph doubles as a travel watch with a two-time-zone mechanism. The new collection has generated significant buzz, with a long waiting list, and is expected to be a coveted Christmas gift.

site_title: Plastics failure is a canary in the climate coalmine
summary: A UN meeting in South Korea to address plastic pollution failed to reach a consensus, with countries unable to agree on a treaty to prevent plastic pollution. The failure is attributed to the influence of oil-exporting countries, which have veto power and often prioritize their economic interests over environmental goals. Despite the failure, the author emphasizes that the real challenge lies in eliminating plastics from our daily lives, as viable substitutes have yet to be found. The UN's inability to act is contrasted with its success in addressing ozone layer depletion and climate change.

site_title: A Gucci gift guide: When fashion meets festivity
summary: Gucci's Christmas gift guide features iconic designs with festive touches, including a limited-edition Murano glass bauble set, the Ophidia bag, and a collection of classic luxury seekers and zillennials-inspired accessories. The luxury brand offers timeless elegance, contemporary charm, and bold aesthetics, with prices ranging from S$1,000 to S$10,200. Gucci's Christmas gift list caters to various tastes, from statement sneakers to classic loafers, perfect for spoiling oneself or a loved one this holiday season.

site_title: A feast for the holidays
summary: Singapore's top hotels offer extravagant holiday menus, including a la carte dishes, buffets, and takeaways. Sheraton Towers Singapore features decadent feasts, while The Fullerton Hotels offer indulgent feasts and elegant afternoon teas. voco Orchard Singapore boasts lavish buffets and Italian specialities, and Pan Pacific Orchard offers exclusive brunches, elegant afternoon teas, and hearty takeaways. Each hotel provides a unique festive experience with options for home and in-hotel celebrations, including 15% off festive takeaways at The Fullerton Hotels.

site_title: The many gifts of Glenn Yong
summary: Glenn Yong, a 28-year-old Singaporean actor, musician, and entrepreneur, is taking a step back to reflect on his life and priorities. After a whirlwind few years, Yong has decided to focus on rest and self-care, aiming to clock 7 hours of sleep a night. He credits his success to his relentless curiosity and drive, which have shaped his creativity and drive. Yong's career has taken off with starring roles in Jack Neo's films, releasing music, and establishing himself in the fashion scene. He plans to debut his first EP in 2025 and balance ambition with serenity in the new year.
